ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My writing and speaking greatly improved. Michael encouraged us to be confident when speaking which really helped build a positive learning environment.

The focus on conversational skills helped my confidence in speaking. I also found it very interesting translating from old Italian to modern Italian, and from Italian to English. I had not done it before in my Italian studies, and therefore found it challenging and interesting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Learning Italian through a variety of different tools, by translating short stories, poems, films and through conversation and thematic essays definitely helped me develop my Italian skills to a more advanced level.

I think that there could have been more of a focus on grammar. Although it is an L5 course, having a unit on grammar revision (going over grammar points that the class commonly made mistakes on) could have been very helpful to the class as a whole.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
